data.title: [Editor] Deployment info messaging

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
**iOS**

Native iOS deploy from the editor through ios-deploy currently isn't hooked up #1262 

Until this can be solved, the editor should inform the user that this feature isn't currently operational.  It could be a good idea to directly link the issue with a html link from the editor so it opens in system browser.

**Desktop Cross Deploying**

Cross deploying from Windows<->macOS<->Linux isn't working right now either, due to work needing to be done on the CI box to share binaries across build, before packaging.  This should be messaged with an info box as well, until #1264 is closed

data.title: [Editor] Desktop cross deployment between Windows, macOS, Linux
data.body: Being able to cross deploy from Windows, macOS, Linux has worked in past and should work now, the CI distribution tasks need to be split up to generate player binaries before the editor packaging tasks, so they can share binary artifacts.

data.title: Default AssetImporter.requiresCacheFile to false
data.body:
Following @JohnnyWahib's change to allow non-recognized assets to be imported, we ran into an issue with our modified (async) cache code. RequiresCache defaults to true, which is inappropriate for these unrecognized assets, which hits an assert when we collect the details of expected cache files per asset.

The fix for this (defaulting requiresCacheFile to false and setting it to true in appropriate cases) isn't strictly necessary for default Atomic, but it does seem to be the correct approach, so PRing it as well.

data.title: [iOS, Deployment] Hook back up native deployment using ios-deploy
data.body:
Tried both downloading from the website and compiling on my own and both results in the same error:

`
BuildBase::BuildCopyFile: Unable to copy file /Applications/AtomicEditor.app/Contents/Resources/ToolData/Deployment/IOS/AtomicPlayer.app/AtomicPlayer -> /Users/kraxarn/Documents/AtomicProjects/PlatformerGame/Build/iOS-Build/AtomicPlayer.app/AtomicPlayer
`

I can see why though, since AtomicPlayer.app only contains one file, `Pkginfo`.

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
For some reason, the Wiki doesn't like the ``!()[file.png]`` formatting anymore, and the file will disappear into nowhere when trying to edit an existing page using that format. However, the ``[[file.png]]`` formatting does seem to work, and therefore all images need to use this style of formatting instead.

All images are online until an edit is made to a page, so this seems like a rather crucial issue. This isn't hard to fix, though takes a lot of time, will try to finish in Build 2.

data.title: JS- inspector plugin support
data.body:
This will now allow the user to pass customized inspectors through the TS plugin system ( I will PR an example of how it gets used in the existing Atomic plugin example project shortly)

It comes with a change to recognize files with unknown extensions as .assets by using the default AssetImporter types.( I have left this change in a separate commit to be safe)

What this will allow us to do is fire up custom inspectors for currently unsupported file formats by checking the file's extension.

data.title: Generate C++ API documentation #1247
data.body:
This PR adds a task to generate C++ documentation. 
It can be run with `./Build_AtomicEditor.sh --task=build:gendoxygen` I can add a top level task if wanted.
Sadly, Windows is a little iffy as to where to find an installed doxygen.
I stuffed the README.md on the main page, and put in the Thunderbeast & Urho3d footer.

data.title: Generate C++ API documentation
data.body:
Use doxygen to generate C++ documentation
Add a build task for it, require doxygen to be installed to run it
Add the THUNDERBEAST and Urho3D Project copyrights in the C++ doc footer
Fill out the doc title page with pertinent information.

data.title: Capture TurboBadger hashtable fix and more #1205
data.body:
Upgraded turbobadger some, it includes commits/prs:
ee05368  API for multitouch
898cc72  Added some unit tests & fixed bug in TBHashTable. 
TBWindow should have a virtual destructor #102
Fix TBImage::IsEmpty #93

I had to do some additional fixes for ee05368, I saw during compile that InvokePointerDown() and InvokePointerUp() were expecting to return bool, but they were still returning void, so I fixed them to the spirit in which they were intended.

Tested on Android as best as I could, see #1205 for details.

data.title: [Player] Create example of switching between scenes using serialization from logic components

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
After investigation on why @toddgibson wasn't being able to switch scenes, I tried to achieve that and failed miserably; ended up discovering some problems:

Ref: https://files.gitter.im/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/tLTP/blob

As reported by @toddgibson, LoadScene() doesn't discard the current scene, but I'm not sure if that's the intended behavior. Since he wanted to effectively 'switch' scenes, I started looking for a way to manually remove the previous scene in a component.

Cadaver said somewhere that Scene.LoadXML should remove all previous data, but that also doesn't happen. I've also tried storing the previous scene and calling Clear(), Remove(), GetNode().Remove(), SetEnabled(false) and all of these simply crash the engine. Either when called before or after loading the next scene, cached or not.

I thought that was because the Viewport wasn't switching scenes properly but even just a `GetSubsystem<Viewport>().SetScene(yourScene)` also crashes the engine.

Even if you just disable the camera on your first scene and call LoadScene() to load another scene, the engine will also crash.

Confirmed for loading scenes from C# component on Build 1. Need confirmation for other languages.

Reproduction steps: Create a new project in the editor, in the default scene disable the camera, create another scene and try to load it from a component in the first scene, compile and play. Optionally, re-enable the camera in the first scene, if you play now everything works, but the first scene can't be removed no matter what.

data.title: [Graphics] Physically Based Rendering and More
data.body:
## Overview
PBR is something I have been working on for some time and there are a few blocking features and ideas on what I'm going to implement. Here I will list everything related to progress.

**Help is always welcome**

## Blocking

- [ ] Way to enable HDR in editor
- [ ] Way to enable different Post Processing in editor
- [ ] Way to pre-filter cubemaps (CMFT)
- [ ] Multiple cubemap zones per mesh

## Features

- [x] Add BRDF shading
- [x] Add IBL
- [x] Area Lighting
- [x] Physically based light values
- [ ] Pre-Filtered IBL
- [ ] Sub-Surface Shading
- [ ] Clearcoat materials
- [ ] Anisotropy materials
- [ ] Parralax correct cubemaps
- [ ] Parralax Occlusion Mapping
- [ ] Screen Space Reflectons
- [ ] Clustered Deferred Rendering
- [ ] SVOGI or alternitive
- [ ] Volumetric Clouds
- [ ] Volumetric Particles
- [ ] Volumetric Fog
- [ ] Temportal AA
- [ ] Improved shadow filtering

data.title: Potential array out of bounds access #993
data.body: This PR plugs a hole for a potential crash from calling ParticleEffect2D API, and fixes the ability for a ParticleEmitter2D to use the Duration setting in a pex file.

This is also a good opportunity to double check AUTHORS.md

data.body: Just a quick fix, dunno if acceptable

data.title: Unsupported files not showing up in the Project Frame
data.body:
Atomic's project frame doesn't show files in a project with extensions that it doesn't support. I would like to change this so that these files are still recognized as project assets (having a .asset as well), but are clearly marked that they are not read by default using a specific GUI icon instead. This should allow users to write customized, project specific assets and inspectors in the editor more freely by passing information through generic/preexisting events to the current TS plugin system. 

Any thoughts on why exposing unsupported files to the editor is potentially a bad idea?

data.title: Add a flag to set whether non-skinned bones should be included
data.body: In some cases it's necessary to import non-skinned bones on a skinned model. OpenAssetImporter ignores them by default,

data.title: [WINDOWS] Fix for blurred text in editor under OpenGL on Windows.
data.body: This was due to scaling logic in TurboBadger/renderers/tb_renderer_batcher.cpp not accounting for the OpenGL case.

data.title: [Windows] Text in editor is blurry on OpenGL Windows build
data.body:
Text in editor is blurry on OpenGL Windows build

This is due to scaling logic in the tb_renderer_batcher class not taking into account OpenGL
